So I’m a little desperate for cash rn, so even if you can’t commission me, reblogs help.

i’m even gonna open my store probably tomorrow, and nothing is preorder, just what I have available in stock.

summary: Subtle tensions exist between different groups of heroes, depending on their places of work and specialisations. Midnight and...
body:
Subtle tensions exist between different groups of heroes, depending on their places of work and specialisations.

Midnight and Eraserhead, for example, are close-range combats. They need to get close to incapacitate their targets and thus often face the risk of injury. They hold, unconsciously, prejudices against heroes with long-range or area-of-effect Quirks - like Present Mic - who attack from a distance.

They believe these heroes to be less professional because they lack the same kind of combat experience they have. They believe them to be less professional if those heroes get sick, because obviously they don’t take care of themselves well enough, which will affect their work, and because obviously they think they can get away with getting sick because they rarely get badly hurt.

Another lines of bias is against underground heroes who often have quirks dubbed unfairly villainous - or not flashy. Daytime heroes often deride them for that or that they’re not strong enough to save people.

Rescue heroes are held highly in regard for their work of saving people in catastrophes. Many of their close-combat and long-range-combat colleagues still think they should have more combat experience, however, and deem them useless when villains get involved.

And intersections of those prejudices happen. A lot.

Certainly, some fit into the stereotypes perfectly. Some heroes with long-range Quirks are too careless when they are on the job. Some rescue heroes haven’t learned all the potential uses for their Quirks or are bad in fights when they stumble across villains (like it happened with Thirteen).

That doesn’t change it’s an unfair bias because there’s a reason heroes specialize. A rescue hero will never be as good at their job if they add intensive combat training as they’ll be if they instead focus solely on rescue training. A long-range hero’s Quirk is too dangerous in close quarters or their body simply isn’t made for it.

The bias stems from the hero industries’ obsession with fights between heroes and villains - the supposed Good vs Evil that can only be won by violence - a bias many involved buy into. You see that with Eraserhead, who always escalates fights, derides Present Mic when he gets sick, and is a hypocritical ass because he doesn’t take care of his own body either.

summary: Burden to Bear - Chapter 4 - AerisLei - 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia [Archive of Our Own]
title: Burden to Bear - Chapter 4 - AerisLei - 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Burden to bear updated with the newest chapter!

This chapter: Izuku gains his quirk, and the UA entrance exam takes place!

If you aren’t following start at chapter one here!

DadMight AU in which Izuku is actually All Might’s son, and knows it, but All Might hasn’t allowed the information to go public. Izuku knows why it’s always been a secret, but there is some part of him that wonders if there is more to it than just protecting him and his mom. Izuku is believed to be quirkless before receiving One for All, but actually isn’t.

blog.description: A blog for me to share my love of Hamilton, BTS, and everything anime! I write fanfiction for multiple fandoms, taking requests and commissions. Enjoy!^^

title: Misunderstanding (Tokoyami Fumikage x Shy!Reader)
body:
Reader’s Quirk: Weretiger (can turn into a giant Siberian tiger)





“Bro look, she’s doing it again!”

“Again!? Should we do something this time?”

“I don’t know.” Shrugging, Kaminari stared at you as you gazed at Tokoyami, what he perceived to be a predatory gleam in your tiger-like eyes.

“This is bad! She totally wants to eat him!” Sero assumed, shaking the blonde boy’s shoulder. “What do we do?!”

“…Idiots,” Bakugou scoffed as he walked by.

“What’s going on?” Kirishima stopped, blinking curiously.

“(L/n)’s staring at Tokoyami again!” Kaminari pointed to where you stood a ways away, shuffling your feet as your eyes remained glued to Tokoyami who walked by without a clue that he was being watched.

As they watched, you shook yourself out a little and followed after the crow-headed boy, making Sero and Kaminari freak out.

“Dude, we have to do something!!! She’s going to eat him!!!” Sero was near tears at this point as he gripped his friend’s arm.

“Come on, I have an idea!” Half dragging the other boy, Kaminari ran off towards where you had disappeared in pursuit of Tokoyami, leaving Kirishima to stare after the two, one eyebrow quirked in confusion.

“What was that about? Can’t they tell she has a crush on him?”





Gulping, your fists clenched and unclenched nervously, palms sweaty. Today was the day! You were finally going to confess to the boy you’d been crushing on for months!

Ahead of you, the object of your affections ran a hand through his black feathers, catching sight of you following him from the corner of his eye. You froze, unable to breath, as Tokoyami turned his red eyes on you questioningly.

As he stared at you, bird-like eyes making your heart beat faster, you almost lost the courage it’d taken you months to summon. Everything you’d practiced was thrown out the window as your mind went blank, an embarrassing blush creeping up your neck and making your face burn.

‘Say something, idiot!’ your mind screamed.

“(L/n)?” Tokoyami tilted his head to the side, the movement like that of a curious bird.

Gulping, your mouth opened and closed a few times before you took a deep breath.

'Just tell him you like him! Simple as that!’

“Toko-!”

“Hey! Tokoyami what’s up!” Seeming to appear out of nowhere, Kaminari and Sero wrapped their arms around the feathered boy’s shoulders, all easy laughs and smiles, without a clue as to what they’d just interrupted.

You blinked, mouth hanging open as the relationship changing words you’d been about to say died on your tongue. As you watched with wide, surprised eyes, Kaminari and Sero pulled Tokoyami away, already talking about something that you couldn’t really make out over the blood rushing in your ears.

Sighing, you leaned your forehead against a wall, trying to calm your still racing heartbeat. A part of you was relieved by the distraction- what if Tokoyami had rejected you, after all?- but, after devoting so much effort and planning to this one, simple confession, disappointment quickly replaced your momentary relief.

Sighing again, you pulled your shoulders back and shook your head, shedding the heavy feeling that had entered your heart. You may not have been able to confess this time, but there’d be other opportunities! What mattered most was that you didn’t give up! Heartened, you blinked your tiger-like eyes and continued on your way.





“Dude, that was so close!”

“I know! She was totally about to eat him!”

“We barely made it in time!”

Having successfully “saved” Tokoyami from the clutches of death, Kaminari and Sero slumped against each other, trying to catch their breath.

“That was kinda scary actually…” Sero mumbled, shivering a little. “Did you see the glimmer in her eyes?”

“I did! It was really scary!”

“Wait…do you think she’ll try again?”

Both boys froze, brains slowly processing the idea, before suddenly springing up, falling over each other in their rush to find Tokoyami and protect him from your savage jaws once more.





“Okay, second try!” you mumbled to yourself, fists clenched in determination. Taking a deep breath, you walked up to where Tokoyami stood leaning against a wall, reading, before class started. “You can do it!” you whispered softly, trying to appear composed despite how fast your heart was pounding. “H-hey, Tokoyami!”

“Hmm? Oh, (L/n), good morning. Sorry about what happened earlier.”

“Huh? Oh! T-That’s okay! No problem!” Waving your hands in front of you, you hurriedly dismissed his apology, the beginnings of a nervous sweat breaking out on your palms.

'Now’s the perfect opportunity! Confess!’

“So, um, the thing is-!”

“Tokoyami! I really need your help with something before class starts!” Kaminari barreled into the cool mannered boy, nearly knocking him off his feet.

“It’s really important, man! We gotta go now!” Joining Kaminari, Sero grabbed Tokoyami’s arm, both boys dragging their surprised classmate away.

You stood frozen for a few seconds, mouth hanging open, before a deep, animalistic growl rumbled in your chest. Before it could grow, you swallowed forcefully, pushing down the tiger you could feel just below your skin. Whereas you were surprised before, now you were more annoyed. The first time this happened seemed like a likely coincidence, but a second time? No, Sero and Kaminari were up to something, you just didn’t know what.





“What was that about?” Tokoyami questioned, clearly annoyed.

“Uhhhhhh…” Kaminari looked back and forth between the feathered boy and Sero, lacking an excuse.

“W-Well, you know! We need your help!” Sero tried.

“With what?”

“With what? Uhh…” It was Sero’s turn to look between Tokoyami and Kaminari, asking for help. Red eyes narrowing, Tokoyami crossed his arms, his annoyance obviously growing.

“We-We were saving you, okay?!” Kaminari confessed, breaking under the crow-headed boy’s scrutiny.

Tokoyami blinked, confused. “Saving me? What are you talking about?”

“From (l/n)! She’s trying to eat you!”

A few silent beats passed before Tokoyami groaned, one hand palming his forehead.

“Both of you are complete-.”

“That was it? You thought I was trying to eat him?!” a usually timid voice said from around the corner, startling them. Stepping out, you leveled Kaminari and Sero with a glare, tiger eyes blazing. “That’s so stupid! Why would I be trying to eat him?!”

“You’re a tiger, a cat! And he’s a bird!”

“We’re people, not animals! You two are ridiculous!” You could feel the frustrated tears forming in your eyes, but you couldn’t help it, too embarrassed and upset to be shy like usual. Before you could think about it, the truth slipped out of your mouth. “I was trying to confess to him, not eat him!”

A second too late you realized what you’d done, your hands covering your mouth. Your eyes dropped to the floor, unable to see the stunned faces of the three boys in front of you. Mind racing, you tried to think of what to do in this situation. Run? Don’t run?

“No way!” Kaminari and Sero screeched in unison, disbelieving.

Run. You decided to run.

Turning on your heel, you fled, tears of mortification beginning to fall down your face. Behind you voices called your name, but you ignored them, human body shifting into that of a Siberian tiger.

'They thought I was going to eat him and now he knows! Tokoyami knows I like him and any chance I had is gone!’

Heart hammering, you clawed your way up a tree blindly, hiding yourself in the dense branches. All you wanted to do at this point was disappear, forget about everything that had happened. You were so deeply ingrained in your thoughts that you didn’t realize you weren’t alone.

A tentative hand touched your furred shoulder, almost making you fall off your branch in surprise. Spinning around, you took in a winded Tokoyami, his fingers burying into your thick fur in an effort to keep you from running away.

“(L/n)…(y/n), are you okay? Those two are just idiots, alright? Don’t let them upset you.”

A few awkward, silent moments passed before you let yourself shift back into human form, Tokoyami’s hand leaving you shoulder uncertainly.

“Was…” he trailed off, fidgeting a little. “Was what you said true? Were you trying to confess to me?”

“…Yes,” you murmured quietly, keeping your eyes turned away. There wasn’t any point in lying now, the had already admitted it earlier.

“So…you like me?” Tokoyami almost sounded…nervous? Peaking at him, you saw him shift uncomfortably, his eyes still glued to you with an expression you couldn’t place.

“…Yes,” you whispered, blushing. Tokoyami sighed next to you, his tense shoulders relaxing.

“T-That’s good…”

You blinked at him curiously. What did that mean?

“I like you too.”

'What?’

“I really like you, (y/n).”

You couldn’t help the smile that spread over your face, your tears of embarrassment replaced by tears of happiness.

“(Y/n)?” Tokoyami questioned, alarmed, as your shoulders shook. “It’s okay if you don’t want to go out with me anym-!”

Cutting him off, you turned to fully face your long-time crush and threw your arms around him, hugging him tightly. “Of course I still want to go out with you, Tokoyami! I really like you too!”

Wrapping his arms around you, Tokoyami smiled into your hair, both of you finally happy now that Kaminari and Sero’s nonsensical misunderstanding had been cleared up.

“Tokoyami and (l/n) sitting in a tree~! K-I-S-S-I-N-G~!”

Speaking of Kaminari and Sero…

Didn’t they ever know when to quit? For a split second, the idea of eating them flitted across your mind, but only for a moment. Next time they interrupted though…that was a different story.




A/N: Writer’s block was strong with this one.^^; I do not own My Hero Academia or any of its characters. Thanks for reading!
body_abstract:
Reader’s Quirk: Weretiger (can turn into a giant Siberian tiger)





“Bro look, she’s doing it again!”

“Again!? Should we do something this time?”

“I don’t know.” Shrugging, Kaminari stared at you as you gazed at Tokoyami, what he perceived to be a predatory gleam in your tiger-like eyes.

“This is bad! She totally wants to eat him!” Sero assumed, shaking the blonde boy’s shoulder. “What do we do?!”

reblog.comment:
Reader’s Quirk: Weretiger (can turn into a giant Siberian tiger)





“Bro look, she’s doing it again!”

“Again!? Should we do something this time?”

“I don’t know.” Shrugging, Kaminari stared at you as you gazed at Tokoyami, what he perceived to be a predatory gleam in your tiger-like eyes.

“This is bad! She totally wants to eat him!” Sero assumed, shaking the blonde boy’s shoulder. “What do we do?!”

[[MORE]]

“…Idiots,” Bakugou scoffed as he walked by.

“What’s going on?” Kirishima stopped, blinking curiously.

“(L/n)’s staring at Tokoyami again!” Kaminari pointed to where you stood a ways away, shuffling your feet as your eyes remained glued to Tokoyami who walked by without a clue that he was being watched.

As they watched, you shook yourself out a little and followed after the crow-headed boy, making Sero and Kaminari freak out.

“Dude, we have to do something!!! She’s going to eat him!!!” Sero was near tears at this point as he gripped his friend’s arm.

“Come on, I have an idea!” Half dragging the other boy, Kaminari ran off towards where you had disappeared in pursuit of Tokoyami, leaving Kirishima to stare after the two, one eyebrow quirked in confusion.

“What was that about? Can’t they tell she has a crush on him?”





Gulping, your fists clenched and unclenched nervously, palms sweaty. Today was the day! You were finally going to confess to the boy you’d been crushing on for months!

Ahead of you, the object of your affections ran a hand through his black feathers, catching sight of you following him from the corner of his eye. You froze, unable to breath, as Tokoyami turned his red eyes on you questioningly.

As he stared at you, bird-like eyes making your heart beat faster, you almost lost the courage it’d taken you months to summon. Everything you’d practiced was thrown out the window as your mind went blank, an embarrassing blush creeping up your neck and making your face burn.

‘Say something, idiot!’ your mind screamed.

“(L/n)?” Tokoyami tilted his head to the side, the movement like that of a curious bird.

Gulping, your mouth opened and closed a few times before you took a deep breath.

'Just tell him you like him! Simple as that!’

“Toko-!”

“Hey! Tokoyami what’s up!” Seeming to appear out of nowhere, Kaminari and Sero wrapped their arms around the feathered boy’s shoulders, all easy laughs and smiles, without a clue as to what they’d just interrupted.

You blinked, mouth hanging open as the relationship changing words you’d been about to say died on your tongue. As you watched with wide, surprised eyes, Kaminari and Sero pulled Tokoyami away, already talking about something that you couldn’t really make out over the blood rushing in your ears.

Sighing, you leaned your forehead against a wall, trying to calm your still racing heartbeat. A part of you was relieved by the distraction- what if Tokoyami had rejected you, after all?- but, after devoting so much effort and planning to this one, simple confession, disappointment quickly replaced your momentary relief.

Sighing again, you pulled your shoulders back and shook your head, shedding the heavy feeling that had entered your heart. You may not have been able to confess this time, but there’d be other opportunities! What mattered most was that you didn’t give up! Heartened, you blinked your tiger-like eyes and continued on your way.





“Dude, that was so close!”

“I know! She was totally about to eat him!”

“We barely made it in time!”

Having successfully “saved” Tokoyami from the clutches of death, Kaminari and Sero slumped against each other, trying to catch their breath.

“That was kinda scary actually…” Sero mumbled, shivering a little. “Did you see the glimmer in her eyes?”

“I did! It was really scary!”

“Wait…do you think she’ll try again?”

Both boys froze, brains slowly processing the idea, before suddenly springing up, falling over each other in their rush to find Tokoyami and protect him from your savage jaws once more.





“Okay, second try!” you mumbled to yourself, fists clenched in determination. Taking a deep breath, you walked up to where Tokoyami stood leaning against a wall, reading, before class started. “You can do it!” you whispered softly, trying to appear composed despite how fast your heart was pounding. “H-hey, Tokoyami!”

“Hmm? Oh, (L/n), good morning. Sorry about what happened earlier.”

“Huh? Oh! T-That’s okay! No problem!” Waving your hands in front of you, you hurriedly dismissed his apology, the beginnings of a nervous sweat breaking out on your palms.

'Now’s the perfect opportunity! Confess!’

“So, um, the thing is-!”

“Tokoyami! I really need your help with something before class starts!” Kaminari barreled into the cool mannered boy, nearly knocking him off his feet.

“It’s really important, man! We gotta go now!” Joining Kaminari, Sero grabbed Tokoyami’s arm, both boys dragging their surprised classmate away.

You stood frozen for a few seconds, mouth hanging open, before a deep, animalistic growl rumbled in your chest. Before it could grow, you swallowed forcefully, pushing down the tiger you could feel just below your skin. Whereas you were surprised before, now you were more annoyed. The first time this happened seemed like a likely coincidence, but a second time? No, Sero and Kaminari were up to something, you just didn’t know what.





“What was that about?” Tokoyami questioned, clearly annoyed.

“Uhhhhhh…” Kaminari looked back and forth between the feathered boy and Sero, lacking an excuse.

“W-Well, you know! We need your help!” Sero tried.

“With what?”

“With what? Uhh…” It was Sero’s turn to look between Tokoyami and Kaminari, asking for help. Red eyes narrowing, Tokoyami crossed his arms, his annoyance obviously growing.

“We-We were saving you, okay?!” Kaminari confessed, breaking under the crow-headed boy’s scrutiny.

Tokoyami blinked, confused. “Saving me? What are you talking about?”

“From (l/n)! She’s trying to eat you!”

A few silent beats passed before Tokoyami groaned, one hand palming his forehead.

“Both of you are complete-.”

“That was it? You thought I was trying to eat him?!” a usually timid voice said from around the corner, startling them. Stepping out, you leveled Kaminari and Sero with a glare, tiger eyes blazing. “That’s so stupid! Why would I be trying to eat him?!”

“You’re a tiger, a cat! And he’s a bird!”

“We’re people, not animals! You two are ridiculous!” You could feel the frustrated tears forming in your eyes, but you couldn’t help it, too embarrassed and upset to be shy like usual. Before you could think about it, the truth slipped out of your mouth. “I was trying to confess to him, not eat him!”

A second too late you realized what you’d done, your hands covering your mouth. Your eyes dropped to the floor, unable to see the stunned faces of the three boys in front of you. Mind racing, you tried to think of what to do in this situation. Run? Don’t run?

“No way!” Kaminari and Sero screeched in unison, disbelieving.

Run. You decided to run.

Turning on your heel, you fled, tears of mortification beginning to fall down your face. Behind you voices called your name, but you ignored them, human body shifting into that of a Siberian tiger.

'They thought I was going to eat him and now he knows! Tokoyami knows I like him and any chance I had is gone!’

Heart hammering, you clawed your way up a tree blindly, hiding yourself in the dense branches. All you wanted to do at this point was disappear, forget about everything that had happened. You were so deeply ingrained in your thoughts that you didn’t realize you weren’t alone.

A tentative hand touched your furred shoulder, almost making you fall off your branch in surprise. Spinning around, you took in a winded Tokoyami, his fingers burying into your thick fur in an effort to keep you from running away.

“(L/n)…(y/n), are you okay? Those two are just idiots, alright? Don’t let them upset you.”

A few awkward, silent moments passed before you let yourself shift back into human form, Tokoyami’s hand leaving you shoulder uncertainly.

“Was…” he trailed off, fidgeting a little. “Was what you said true? Were you trying to confess to me?”

“…Yes,” you murmured quietly, keeping your eyes turned away. There wasn’t any point in lying now, the had already admitted it earlier.

“So…you like me?” Tokoyami almost sounded…nervous? Peaking at him, you saw him shift uncomfortably, his eyes still glued to you with an expression you couldn’t place.

“…Yes,” you whispered, blushing. Tokoyami sighed next to you, his tense shoulders relaxing.

“T-That’s good…”

You blinked at him curiously. What did that mean?

“I like you too.”

'What?’

“I really like you, (y/n).”

You couldn’t help the smile that spread over your face, your tears of embarrassment replaced by tears of happiness.

“(Y/n)?” Tokoyami questioned, alarmed, as your shoulders shook. “It’s okay if you don’t want to go out with me anym-!”

Cutting him off, you turned to fully face your long-time crush and threw your arms around him, hugging him tightly. “Of course I still want to go out with you, Tokoyami! I really like you too!”

Wrapping his arms around you, Tokoyami smiled into your hair, both of you finally happy now that Kaminari and Sero’s nonsensical misunderstanding had been cleared up.

“Tokoyami and (l/n) sitting in a tree~! K-I-S-S-I-N-G~!”

Speaking of Kaminari and Sero…

Didn’t they ever know when to quit? For a split second, the idea of eating them flitted across your mind, but only for a moment. Next time they interrupted though…that was a different story.




A/N: Writer’s block was strong with this one.^^; I do not own My Hero Academia or any of its characters. Thanks for reading!

“From (l/n)! She’s trying to eat you!”

“Both of you are complete-.”

“I really like you, (y/n).”

You couldn’t help the smile that spread over your face, your tears of embarrassment replaced by tears of happiness.

“What was that about?” Tokoyami questioned, clearly annoyed.

“Uhhhhhh…” Kaminari looked back and forth between the feathered boy and Sero, lacking an excuse.

“W-Well, you know! We need your help!” Sero tried.

“With what?”

“With what? Uhh…” It was Sero’s turn to look between Tokoyami and Kaminari, asking for help. Red eyes narrowing, Tokoyami crossed his arms, his annoyance obviously growing.

“We-We were saving you, okay?!” Kaminari confessed, breaking under the crow-headed boy’s scrutiny.

Tokoyami blinked, confused. “Saving me? What are you talking about?”

“From (l/n)! She’s trying to eat you!”

A few silent beats passed before Tokoyami groaned, one hand palming his forehead.

“Both of you are complete-.”

“That was it? You thought I was trying to eat him?!” a usually timid voice said from around the corner, startling them. Stepping out, you leveled Kaminari and Sero with a glare, tiger eyes blazing. “That’s so stupid! Why would I be trying to eat him?!”

“You’re a tiger, a cat! And he’s a bird!”

“We’re people, not animals! You two are ridiculous!” You could feel the frustrated tears forming in your eyes, but you couldn’t help it, too embarrassed and upset to be shy like usual. Before you could think about it, the truth slipped out of your mouth. “I was trying to confess to him, not eat him!”

A second too late you realized what you’d done, your hands covering your mouth. Your eyes dropped to the floor, unable to see the stunned faces of the three boys in front of you. Mind racing, you tried to think of what to do in this situation. Run? Don’t run?

“No way!” Kaminari and Sero screeched in unison, disbelieving.

Run. You decided to run.

Turning on your heel, you fled, tears of mortification beginning to fall down your face. Behind you voices called your name, but you ignored them, human body shifting into that of a Siberian tiger.

'They thought I was going to eat him and now he knows! Tokoyami knows I like him and any chance I had is gone!’

Heart hammering, you clawed your way up a tree blindly, hiding yourself in the dense branches. All you wanted to do at this point was disappear, forget about everything that had happened. You were so deeply ingrained in your thoughts that you didn’t realize you weren’t alone.

A tentative hand touched your furred shoulder, almost making you fall off your branch in surprise. Spinning around, you took in a winded Tokoyami, his fingers burying into your thick fur in an effort to keep you from running away.

“(L/n)…(y/n), are you okay? Those two are just idiots, alright? Don’t let them upset you.”

A few awkward, silent moments passed before you let yourself shift back into human form, Tokoyami’s hand leaving you shoulder uncertainly.

“Was…” he trailed off, fidgeting a little. “Was what you said true? Were you trying to confess to me?”

“…Yes,” you murmured quietly, keeping your eyes turned away. There wasn’t any point in lying now, the had already admitted it earlier.

“So…you like me?” Tokoyami almost sounded…nervous? Peaking at him, you saw him shift uncomfortably, his eyes still glued to you with an expression you couldn’t place.

“…Yes,” you whispered, blushing. Tokoyami sighed next to you, his tense shoulders relaxing.

“T-That’s good…”

You blinked at him curiously. What did that mean?

“I like you too.”

'What?’

“I really like you, (y/n).”

You couldn’t help the smile that spread over your face, your tears of embarrassment replaced by tears of happiness.

“(Y/n)?” Tokoyami questioned, alarmed, as your shoulders shook. “It’s okay if you don’t want to go out with me anym-!”

Cutting him off, you turned to fully face your long-time crush and threw your arms around him, hugging him tightly. “Of course I still want to go out with you, Tokoyami! I really like you too!”

Wrapping his arms around you, Tokoyami smiled into your hair, both of you finally happy now that Kaminari and Sero’s nonsensical misunderstanding had been cleared up.

“Tokoyami and (l/n) sitting in a tree~! K-I-S-S-I-N-G~!”

Speaking of Kaminari and Sero…

Didn’t they ever know when to quit? For a split second, the idea of eating them flitted across your mind, but only for a moment. Next time they interrupted though…that was a different story.




A/N: Writer’s block was strong with this one.^^; I do not own My Hero Academia or any of its characters. Thanks for reading!
trail.content_abstract:
Reader’s Quirk: Weretiger (can turn into a giant Siberian tiger)





“Bro look, she’s doing it again!”

“Again!? Should we do something this time?”

“I don’t know.” Shrugging, Kaminari stared at you as you gazed at Tokoyami, what he perceived to be a predatory gleam in your tiger-like eyes.

“This is bad! She totally wants to eat him!” Sero assumed, shaking the blonde boy’s shoulder. “What do we do?!”
